explanation: The report is not correct. The cast-to-void statements such as "(void) url;" are an idiomatic, intentional way to mark parameters as unused and to suppress compiler warnings. Although such a statement is a no-op at runtime (removing it will not change the program’s observable runtime behaviour), MISRA’s prohibition of dead code is aimed at truly unintended code that serves no purpose; the void-cast is intentionally present to document the unused parameter and to influence diagnostics. Removing it can change compiler diagnostics (warnings) and the source-level intent, so it is not the kind of unintended dead code Rule 2.2 targets. Therefore agent A’s claim of a Rule 2.2 violation is incorrect.
